snippet: Since the Boston Marathon bombings, community activists, clergy members and others have used the mounting tally of shootings to call attention to the everyday reality of violence in their communities.
abstract: Some residents of Boston's more violence-prone neighborhoods say the attention city received after Boston Marathon bombings has made them feel only more isolated; community activists, clergy members and others have used the mounting tally of shootings to call attention to the everyday reality of violence and to push for measures to address the weapons trafficking, gangs, and fundamental mistrust between the community and the police.
lead_paragraph: Since the Boston Marathon bombings, community activists, clergy members and others have used the mounting tally of shootings to call attention to the everyday reality of violence in their communities.

headline.main: Violence Rises in Boston Off the National Stage
headline.print_headline: Violence Rises in Boston Off the National Stage
